title:
Towards Proof-Theoretic Formulation of the General Theory of
  Term-Forming Operators
abstract:
Term-forming operators (tfos), like iota- or epsilon-operator, are technical
devices applied to build complex terms in formal languages. Although they are
very useful in practice their theory is not well developed. In the paper we
provide a proof-theoretic formulation of the general approach to tfos provided
independently by several authors like Scott, Hatcher, Corcoran, and compare it
with an approach proposed later by Tennant. Eventually it is shown how the
general theory can be applied to specific areas like Quine's set theory NF.
